message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SY

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new approach for training binary neural networks using the Bayesian learning rule. It also mentions the use of gradient-based methods, which are commonly used in machine learning. 

It could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it deals with neural networks and their training. 

The paper also mentions the use of binary weights in neural networks, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. Therefore, it could belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper proposes a new algorithm for training binary neural networks, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Finally, the paper mentions the use of uncertainty estimation for continual learning, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control).
